verses.verse: Keep silence<WH2790> before<WH413> me, O islands;<WH339> and let the people<WH3816> renew<WH2498> their strength:<WH3581> let them come<WH5066> near;<WH5066> then<WH227> let them speak:<WH1696> let us come<WH7126> near<WH7126> together<WH3162> to judgment.<WH4941>

Who<WH4310> raised<WH5782> up the righteous<WH6664> man from the east,<WH4217> called<WH7121> him to his foot,<WH7272> gave<WH5414> the nations<WH1471> before<WH6440> him, and made him rule<WH7287> over kings?<WH4428> he gave<WH5414> them as the dust<WH6083> to his sword,<WH2719> and as driven<WH5086> stubble<WH7179> to his bow.<WH7198>
He pursued<WH7291> them, and passed<WH5674> safely;<WH7965> even by the way<WH734> that he had not gone<WH935> with his feet.<WH7272>
Who<WH4310> has worked<WH6466> and done<WH6213> it, calling<WH7121> the generations<WH1755> from the beginning?<WH7218> I the LORD,<WH3068> the first,<WH7223> and with the last;<WH314> I am he.
The isles<WH339> saw<WH7200> it, and feared;<WH3372> the ends<WH7098> of the earth<WH776> were afraid,<WH2729> drew near,<WH7126> and came.<WH857>
They helped<WH5826> every<WH376> one<WH376> his neighbor;<WH7453> and every<WH376> one<WH376> said<WH559> to his brother,<WH251> Be of good<WH1319> courage.<WH2388>

So the carpenter<WH2796> encouraged<WH2388> the goldsmith,<WH6884> and he that smoothes<WH2505> with the hammer<WH6360> him that smote<WH1986> the anvil,<WH6471> saying,<WH559> It is ready<WH2896> for the soldering:<WH1694> and he fastened<WH2388> it with nails,<WH4548> that it should not be moved.<WH4131>
But you, Israel,<WH3478> are my servant,<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> whom<WH834> I have chosen,<WH977> the seed<WH2233> of Abraham<WH85> my friend.<WH157>

You whom<WH834> I have taken<WH2388> from the ends<WH7098> of the earth,<WH776> and called<WH7121> you from the chief<WH678> men thereof, and said<WH559> to you, You are my servant;<WH5650> I have chosen<WH977> you, and not cast<WH3988> you away.

Fear<WH3372> you not; for I am with you: be not dismayed;<WH8159> for I am your God:<WH430> I will strengthen<WH553> you; yes,<WH637> I will help<WH5826> you; yes,<WH637> I will uphold<WH8551> you with the right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> of my righteousness.<WH6664>

Behold,<WH2005> all<WH3605> they that were incensed<WH2734> against you shall be ashamed<WH954> and confounded:<WH3637> they shall be as nothing;<WH369> and they that strive<WH7379> with you shall perish.<WH6>

You shall seek<WH1245> them, and shall not find<WH4672> them, even them that contended<WH4695> with you: they that war<WH4421> against you shall be as nothing,<WH369> and as a thing of nothing.<WH657>
For I the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> will hold<WH2388> your right<WH3225> hand,<WH3225> saying<WH559> to you, Fear<WH3372> not; I will help<WH5826> you.

Fear<WH3372> not, you worm<WH8438> Jacob,<WH3290> and you men<WH4962> of Israel;<WH3478> I will help<WH5826> you, said<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> and your redeemer,<WH1350> the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel.<WH3478>

Behold,<WH2009> I will make<WH7760> you a new<WH2319> sharp<WH2742> threshing<WH4173> instrument having<WH1167> teeth:<WH6374> you shall thresh<WH1758> the mountains,<WH2022> and beat<WH1854> them small,<WH1854> and shall make<WH7760> the hills<WH1389> as chaff.<WH4671>

You shall fan<WH2219> them, and the wind<WH7307> shall carry<WH5375> them away, and the whirlwind<WH5591> shall scatter<WH6327> them: and you shall rejoice<WH1523> in the LORD,<WH3068> and shall glory<WH1984> in the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel.<WH3478>

When the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34> seek<WH1245> water,<WH4325> and there is none,<WH369> and their tongue<WH3956> fails<WH5405> for thirst,<WH6772> I the LORD<WH3068> will hear<WH6030> them, I the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> will not forsake<WH5800> them.

I will open<WH6605> rivers<WH5103> in high<WH8205> places, and fountains<WH4599> in the middle<WH8432> of the valleys:<WH1237> I will make<WH7760> the wilderness<WH4057> a pool<WH98> of water,<WH4325> and the dry<WH6723> land<WH776> springs<WH4161> of water.<WH4325>

I will plant<WH5414> in the wilderness<WH4057> the cedar,<WH730> the shittah<WH7848> tree,<WH6086> and the myrtle,<WH1918> and the oil<WH8081> tree; I will set<WH7760> in the desert<WH6160> the fir<WH1265> tree, and the pine,<WH8410> and the box<WH8391> tree together:<WH3162>

That they may see,<WH7200> and know,<WH3045> and consider,<WH7760> and understand<WH7919> together,<WH3162> that the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> has done<WH6213> this,<WH2063> and the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel<WH3478> has created<WH1254> it.
Produce<WH7126> your cause,<WH7379> said<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> bring<WH5066> forth<WH5066> your strong<WH6110> reasons, said<WH559> the King<WH4428> of Jacob.<WH3290>

Let them bring<WH5066> them forth,<WH5066> and show<WH5046> us what<WH853> <WH834> shall happen:<WH7136> let them show<WH5046> the former<WH7223> things, what<WH4100> they be, that we may consider<WH7760> <WH3820> them, and know<WH3045> the latter<WH319> end of them; or declare<WH8085> us things for to come.<WH935>

Show<WH5046> the things that are to come<WH857> hereafter,<WH268> that we may know<WH3045> that you are gods:<WH430> yes,<WH637> do good,<WH3190> or do evil,<WH7489> that we may be dismayed,<WH8159> and behold<WH7200> it together.<WH3162>
Behold,<WH2005> you are of nothing,<WH369> and your work<WH6467> of nothing:<WH659> an abomination<WH8441> is he that chooses<WH977> you.

I have raised<WH5782> up one from the north,<WH6828> and he shall come:<WH857> from the rising<WH4217> of the sun<WH8121> shall he call<WH7121> on my name:<WH8034> and he shall come<WH935> on princes<WH5461> as on mortar,<WH2563> and as the potter<WH3335> treads<WH7429> clay.<WH2916>

Who<WH4310> has declared<WH5046> from the beginning,<WH7218> that we may know?<WH3045> and beforetime,<WH6440> that we may say,<WH559> He is righteous?<WH6662> yes,<WH637> there is none<WH369> that shows,<WH5046> yes,<WH637> there is none<WH369> that declares,<WH5046> yes,<WH637> there is none<WH369> that hears<WH8085> your words.<WH561>
The first<WH7223> shall say to Zion,<WH6726> Behold,<WH2009> behold<WH2009> them: and I will give<WH5414> to Jerusalem<WH3389> one that brings<WH1319> good<WH1319> tidings.<WH1319>
For I beheld,<WH7200> and there was no<WH369> man;<WH376> even among them, and there was no<WH369> counselor,<WH3289> that, when I asked<WH7592> of them, could answer<WH7725> a word.<WH1697>
Behold,<WH2005> they are all<WH3605> vanity;<WH205> their works<WH4639> are nothing:<WH657> their molten<WH5262> images are wind<WH7307> and confusion.<WH8414>
